#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Benchmark script for CPU kernels optimization"""

import time
import torch
import sgl_kernel

def benchmark_norm():
    """Benchmark RMSNorm operations"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking RMSNorm")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    # Test configurations
    batch_sizes = [1024, 4096]
    hidden_sizes = [4096, 8192]
    dtypes = [torch.float16, torch.bfloat16]
    
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for batch_size in batch_sizes:
            for hidden_size in hidden_sizes:
                x = torch.randn([batch_size, hidden_size], dtype=dtype)
                weight = torch.randn(hidden_size, dtype=dtype)
                eps = 1e-6
                
                # Warmup
                for _ in range(5):
                    _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rmsnorm_cpu(x, weight, eps)
                
                # Benchmark
                start = time.perf_counter()
                iterations = 20
                for _ in range(iterations):
                    _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rmsnorm_cpu(x, weight, eps)
                end = time.perf_counter()
                
                avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                print(f"  {dtype}, batch={batch_size}, hidden={hidden_size}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")
    
    # Test fused_add_rmsnorm
    print("\nBenchmarking Fused Add RMSNorm")
    print("-" * 60)
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for batch_size in batch_sizes:
            for hidden_size in hidden_sizes:
                x = torch.randn([batch_size, hidden_size], dtype=dtype)
                residual = torch.randn([batch_size, hidden_size], dtype=dtype)
                weight = torch.randn(hidden_size, dtype=dtype)
                eps = 1e-6
                
                # Warmup
                for _ in range(5):
                    x_copy = x.clone()
                    residual_copy = residual.clone()
                    torch.ops.sgl_kernel.fused_add_rmsnorm_cpu(x_copy, residual_copy, weight, eps)
                
                # Benchmark
                start = time.perf_counter()
                iterations = 20
                for _ in range(iterations):
                    x_copy = x.clone()
                    residual_copy = residual.clone()
                    torch.ops.sgl_kernel.fused_add_rmsnorm_cpu(x_copy, residual_copy, weight, eps)
                end = time.perf_counter()
                
                avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                print(f"  {dtype}, batch={batch_size}, hidden={hidden_size}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


def benchmark_rope():
    """Benchmark RoPE operations"""
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking RoPE")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    seq_lens = [128, 512]
    num_heads = [32, 64]
    rotary_dims = [128, 256]
    dtypes = [torch.float16, torch.bfloat16]
    
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for seq_len in seq_lens:
            for num_head in num_heads:
                for rotary_dim in rotary_dims:
                    t_pos = torch.arange(seq_len, dtype=torch.long)
                    q_pe = torch.randn([seq_len, num_head, rotary_dim], dtype=dtype)
                    k_pe = torch.randn([seq_len, 1, rotary_dim], dtype=dtype)
                    t_emb_pos = torch.randn([8192, rotary_dim], dtype=dtype)
                    
                    # Warmup
                    for _ in range(5):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rotary_position_embedding_cpu(t_pos, q_pe, k_pe, t_emb_pos)
                    
                    # Benchmark
                    start = time.perf_counter()
                    iterations = 20
                    for _ in range(iterations):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rotary_position_embedding_cpu(t_pos, q_pe, k_pe, t_emb_pos)
                    end = time.perf_counter()
                    
                    avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                    print(f"  {dtype}, seq={seq_len}, heads={num_head}, dim={rotary_dim}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


def benchmark_topk():
    """Benchmark TopK operations"""
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking Grouped TopK")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    num_tokens_list = [512, 2048]
    num_experts_list = [64, 128, 256]
    topk_list = [6, 8]
    dtypes = [torch.float16, torch.bfloat16]
    
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for num_tokens in num_tokens_list:
            for num_experts in num_experts_list:
                for topk in topk_list:
                    hidden_states = torch.randn([num_tokens, 4096], dtype=dtype)
                    gating_output = torch.randn([num_tokens, num_experts], dtype=dtype)
                    
                    num_expert_group = 8
                    topk_group = 2
                    
                    # Warmup
                    for _ in range(5):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.grouped_topk_cpu(
                            hidden_states, gating_output, topk, True, num_expert_group, topk_group
                        )
                    
                    # Benchmark
                    start = time.perf_counter()
                    iterations = 10
                    for _ in range(iterations):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.grouped_topk_cpu(
                            hidden_states, gating_output, topk, True, num_expert_group, topk_group
                        )
                    end = time.perf_counter()
                    
                    avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                    print(f"  {dtype}, tokens={num_tokens}, experts={num_experts}, topk={topk}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Starting CPU Kernel Performance Benchmarks")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    benchmark_norm()
    benchmark_rope()
    benchmark_topk()
    
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking Complete")
    print("=" * 60)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Benchmark script for CPU kernels optimization"""

import time
import torch
import sgl_kernel

def benchmark_norm():
    """Benchmark RMSNorm operations"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking RMSNorm")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    # Test configurations
    batch_sizes = [1024, 4096]
    hidden_sizes = [4096, 8192]
    dtypes = [torch.float16, torch.bfloat16]
    
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for batch_size in batch_sizes:
            for hidden_size in hidden_sizes:
                x = torch.randn([batch_size, hidden_size], dtype=dtype)
                weight = torch.randn(hidden_size, dtype=dtype)
                eps = 1e-6
                
                # Warmup
                for _ in range(5):
                    _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rmsnorm_cpu(x, weight, eps)
                
                # Benchmark
                start = time.perf_counter()
                iterations = 20
                for _ in range(iterations):
                    _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rmsnorm_cpu(x, weight, eps)
                end = time.perf_counter()
                
                avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                print(f"  {dtype}, batch={batch_size}, hidden={hidden_size}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")
    
    # Test fused_add_rmsnorm
    print("\nBenchmarking Fused Add RMSNorm")
    print("-" * 60)
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for batch_size in batch_sizes:
            for hidden_size in hidden_sizes:
                x = torch.randn([batch_size, hidden_size], dtype=dtype)
                residual = torch.randn([batch_size, hidden_size], dtype=dtype)
                weight = torch.randn(hidden_size, dtype=dtype)
                eps = 1e-6
                
                # Warmup
                for _ in range(5):
                    x_copy = x.clone()
                    residual_copy = residual.clone()
                    torch.ops.sgl_kernel.fused_add_rmsnorm_cpu(x_copy, residual_copy, weight, eps)
                
                # Benchmark
                start = time.perf_counter()
                iterations = 20
                for _ in range(iterations):
                    x_copy = x.clone()
                    residual_copy = residual.clone()
                    torch.ops.sgl_kernel.fused_add_rmsnorm_cpu(x_copy, residual_copy, weight, eps)
                end = time.perf_counter()
                
                avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                print(f"  {dtype}, batch={batch_size}, hidden={hidden_size}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


def benchmark_rope():
    """Benchmark RoPE operations"""
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking RoPE")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    seq_lens = [128, 512]
    num_heads = [32, 64]
    rotary_dims = [128, 256]
    dtypes = [torch.float16, torch.bfloat16]
    
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for seq_len in seq_lens:
            for num_head in num_heads:
                for rotary_dim in rotary_dims:
                    t_pos = torch.arange(seq_len, dtype=torch.long)
                    q_pe = torch.randn([seq_len, num_head, rotary_dim], dtype=dtype)
                    k_pe = torch.randn([seq_len, 1, rotary_dim], dtype=dtype)
                    t_emb_pos = torch.randn([8192, rotary_dim], dtype=dtype)
                    
                    # Warmup
                    for _ in range(5):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rotary_position_embedding_cpu(t_pos, q_pe, k_pe, t_emb_pos)
                    
                    # Benchmark
                    start = time.perf_counter()
                    iterations = 20
                    for _ in range(iterations):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.rotary_position_embedding_cpu(t_pos, q_pe, k_pe, t_emb_pos)
                    end = time.perf_counter()
                    
                    avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                    print(f"  {dtype}, seq={seq_len}, heads={num_head}, dim={rotary_dim}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


def benchmark_topk():
    """Benchmark TopK operations"""
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking Grouped TopK")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    num_tokens_list = [512, 2048]
    num_experts_list = [64, 128, 256]
    topk_list = [6, 8]
    dtypes = [torch.float16, torch.bfloat16]
    
    for dtype in dtypes:
        for num_tokens in num_tokens_list:
            for num_experts in num_experts_list:
                for topk in topk_list:
                    hidden_states = torch.randn([num_tokens, 4096], dtype=dtype)
                    gating_output = torch.randn([num_tokens, num_experts], dtype=dtype)
                    
                    num_expert_group = 8
                    topk_group = 2
                    
                    # Warmup
                    for _ in range(5):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.grouped_topk_cpu(
                            hidden_states, gating_output, topk, True, num_expert_group, topk_group
                        )
                    
                    # Benchmark
                    start = time.perf_counter()
                    iterations = 10
                    for _ in range(iterations):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.grouped_topk_cpu(
                            hidden_states, gating_output, topk, True, num_expert_group, topk_group
                        )
                    end = time.perf_counter()
                    
                    avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                    print(f"  {dtype}, tokens={num_tokens}, experts={num_experts}, topk={topk}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Starting CPU Kernel Performance Benchmarks")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    benchmark_norm()
    benchmark_rope()
    benchmark_topk()
    
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking Complete")
    print("=" * 60)

                    gating_output = torch.randn([num_tokens, num_experts], dtype=dtype)
                    
                    num_expert_group = 8
                    topk_group = 2
                    
                    # Warmup
                    for _ in range(5):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.grouped_topk_cpu(
                            hidden_states, gating_output, topk, True, num_expert_group, topk_group
                        )
                    
                    # Benchmark
                    start = time.perf_counter()
                    iterations = 10
                    for _ in range(iterations):
                        _ = torch.ops.sgl_kernel.grouped_topk_cpu(
                            hidden_states, gating_output, topk, True, num_expert_group, topk_group
                        )
                    end = time.perf_counter()
                    
                    avg_time = (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms
                    print(f"  {dtype}, tokens={num_tokens}, experts={num_experts}, topk={topk}: {avg_time:.3f} ms")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Starting CPU Kernel Performance Benchmarks")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    benchmark_norm()
    benchmark_rope()
    benchmark_topk()
    
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("Benchmarking Complete")
    print("=" * 60)

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

PYTHON_VERSION=$1
CUDA_VERSION=$2
PYTHON_ROOT_PATH=/opt/python/cp${PYTHON_VERSION//.}-cp${PYTHON_VERSION//.}

if [ -z "$3" ]; then
   ARCH=$(uname -i)
else
   ARCH=$3
fi

echo "ARCH:  $ARCH"
if [ ${ARCH} = "aarch64" ]; then
   LIBCUDA_ARCH="sbsa"
   BUILDER_NAME="pytorch/manylinuxaarch64-builder"
else
   LIBCUDA_ARCH=${ARCH}
   if [ ${CUDA_VERSION} = "12.8" ]; then
      BUILDER_NAME="pytorch/manylinux2_28-builder"
   else
      BUILDER_NAME="pytorch/manylinux-builder"
   fi
fi

if [ ${CUDA_VERSION} = "12.8" ]; then
   DOCKER_IMAGE="${BUILDER_NAME}:cuda${CUDA_VERSION}"
   TORCH_INSTALL="pip install --no-cache-dir torch==2.7.0 --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu${CUDA_VERSION//.}"
else
   DOCKER_IMAGE="${BUILDER_NAME}:cuda${CUDA_VERSION}"
   TORCH_INSTALL="pip install --no-cache-dir torch==2.6.0 --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu${CUDA_VERSION//.}"
fi

docker run --rm \
   -v $(pwd):/sgl-kernel \
   ${DOCKER_IMAGE} \
   bash -c "
   # Install CMake (version >= 3.26) - Robust Installation
   export CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR=3.31
   export CMAKE_VERSION_MINOR=1
   echo \"Downloading CMake from: https://cmake.org/files/v\${CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR}/cmake-\${CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR}.\${CMAKE_VERSION_MINOR}-linux-${ARCH}.tar.gz\"
   wget https://cmake.org/files/v\${CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR}/cmake-\${CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR}.\${CMAKE_VERSION_MINOR}-linux-${ARCH}.tar.gz
   tar -xzf cmake-\${CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR}.\${CMAKE_VERSION_MINOR}-linux-${ARCH}.tar.gz
   mv cmake-\${CMAKE_VERSION_MAJOR}.\${CMAKE_VERSION_MINOR}-linux-${ARCH} /opt/cmake
   export PATH=/opt/cmake/bin:\$PATH

   # Debugging CMake
   echo \"PATH: \$PATH\"
   which cmake
   cmake --version

   ${PYTHON_ROOT_PATH}/bin/${TORCH_INSTALL} && \
   ${PYTHON_ROOT_PATH}/bin/pip install --no-cache-dir ninja setuptools==75.0.0 wheel==0.41.0 numpy uv scikit-build-core && \
   export TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST='7.5 8.0 8.9 9.0+PTX' && \
   export CUDA_VERSION=${CUDA_VERSION} && \
   mkdir -p /usr/lib/${ARCH}-linux-gnu/ && \
   ln -s /usr/local/cuda-${CUDA_VERSION}/targets/${LIBCUDA_ARCH}-linux/lib/stubs/libcuda.so /usr/lib/${ARCH}-linux-gnu/libcuda.so && \

   cd /sgl-kernel && \
   ls -la ${PYTHON_ROOT_PATH}/lib/python${PYTHON_VERSION}/site-packages/wheel/ && \
   PYTHONPATH=${PYTHON_ROOT_PATH}/lib/python${PYTHON_VERSION}/site-packages ${PYTHON_ROOT_PATH}/bin/python -m uv build --wheel -Cbuild-dir=build . --color=always --no-build-isolation && \
   ./rename_wheels.sh
   "

[build-system]
requires = [
  "scikit-build-core>=0.10",
  "torch>=2.6.0",
  "wheel",
]
build-backend = "scikit_build_core.build"

[project]
name = "sgl-kernel"
version = "0.1.5"
description = "Kernel Library for SGLang"
readme = "README.md"
requires-python = ">=3.9"
license = { file = "LICENSE" }
classifiers = [
  "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
  "License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License",
  "Environment :: CPU"
]
dependencies = []

[project.urls]
"Homepage" = "https://github.com/sgl-project/sglang/tree/main/sgl-kernel"
"Bug Tracker" = "https://github.com/sgl-project/sglang/issues"

[tool.wheel]
exclude = [
  "dist*",
  "tests*",
]

[tool.scikit-build]
cmake.source-dir = "csrc/cpu"
cmake.build-type = "Release"
minimum-version = "build-system.requires"
